components.description:
A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a closed zipper for a mouth. Meaning widely varies, but commonly conveys a secret or that someone will keep one (e.g., My lips are sealed). May also be used to tell someone to stop talking (e.g., Zip it! or I’ll shut up now).

Google's design for üòØ Hushed Face previously featured a zipper-mouth.
components.title: Zipper-Mouth Face

description:
A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a closed zipper for a mouth. Meaning widely varies, but commonly conveys a secret or that someone will keep one (e.g., My lips are sealed). May also be used to tell someone to stop talking (e.g., Zip it! or I’ll shut up now).

Google's design for üòØ Hushed Face previously featured a zipper-mouth.
title: Zipper-Mouth Face

version.description: The Unicode Consortium has approved the following 41 emoji characters as part of Unicode 8.0, released on June 17, 2015. This is comprised of 37 new emojis, plus five emoji modifiers. Find out more about this update on the Emojipedia Blog.

emoji_net_data.category: Supplemental Symbols And Pictographs -> Emoticon faces
emoji_net_data.definition: A face with a zipper displayed instead of a mouth. Used to convey a secret, or that one will not discuss a certain matter with others aka ‚Äúm http://emojipedia.org/zipper-mouth-face/
emoji_net_data.name: zipper-mouth face

bn:00110253a: Not open or public; kept private or not revealed
Being or kept hidden from public perception.

bn:00110217a: Closed or secured with or as if with a seal

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00056135n: Mouths are a part of the anatomy constituting the first portion of the alimentary canal that receives food and saliva.
The opening through which food is taken in and vocalizations emerge
First portion of the alimentary canal that receives food

In biological anatomy, commonly referred to as the mouth, under formal names such as the oral cavity, buccal cavity, or in Latin cavum oris, is the opening through which many animals take in food and issue vocal sounds.
Cavity that is limited by the lips in front, the cheeks on the side, the soft and hard palate at the top and the floor of the mouth below.
The opening of a creature through which food is ingested.

bn:00072152n: A fastener used in clothing, bags.
A fastener for locking together two toothed edges by means of a sliding tab
A zipper, zip, fly or zip fastener, formerly known as a clasp locker, is a commonly used device for binding the edges of an opening of fabric or other flexible material, as on a garment or a bag.
A device for temporarily joining two edges of fabric together

A fastener used in clothing, bags, etc, made up of two rows of teeth that are made to fit into each other by moving a slider along their length and opened again by moving the slider in the other direction.

bn:00070159n: Something that should remain hidden from others (especially information that is not to be passed on)
Knowledge that is hidden and intended to be kept hidden.
